natural solution: The greatest common factor of $145b^2$ and $29b$ is $29b$.

a_8.formal problem:
theorem
fixes b :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> b. P b = 145 * b powr 2 + 29 * b"
and h1 : "\<forall> b. Q b = 29 * b"
and h2 : "\<forall> b. R b = 5 * b + 1"
and h3 : "\<forall> b. P b = Q b * R b"
shows  "P = Q * R"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Factor the following expression: $145b^2 +29b$. The final Answer is 29b(5b+1)
 ### Proof

 *)

assumes h0 : "\<forall> b. P b = 145 * b powr 2 + 29 * b"
and h1 : "\<forall> b. Q b = 29 * b"
and h2 : "\<forall> b. R b = 5 * b + 1"
and h3 : "\<forall> b. P b = Q b * R b"
shows  "P = Q * R"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
